page.title: 10HANNINGTON AND ITS CHURCH
page.content: Hannington village was called Hanningdon until 1521.The present population of Hannington is two hundred and twelve.Most people enjoy living there.There are about fifty houses,one pub and one shop,which is also the post office.Otherwise the people shop in Highworth or Swindon.A bus service comes from Castle Eaton through Hannington and Highworth to Swindon every Tuesday,Friday and Saturday.A travelling library comes every Tuesday afternoon. Hannington Parish Church was built in 1230.It has five stained-glass windows,six bells and even some old wall paintings.The surrounding churchyard has three hundred graves. Rev. Richard Dent will be inducted as the new Vicar of Highworth and Hannington on September 2nd 1985.
